newsitem.title: UK: British Airways tumbles on Iraq attack.
newsitem.headline: British Airways tumbles on Iraq attack.

text.p: Shares in British Airways tumbled in active trading amid nervousness that the U.S. strikes against Iraq will sharply reduce international travel, traders said.
The increase in worldwide oil prices resulting from the hostilities in the Middle East further pressured the shares, they said.
By 0846 GMT, shares in British Airways were off 12-1/2p to 512-1/2p.
"A war is a double whammy for British Airways because international travel dries up and then they have higher oil prices, which pressure margins," said one market maker.
Traders said shares in the UK air carrier could fall further if fighting in the Middle East drags on.
